item.title: Why did the Royal Sovereign burn?
item.description: Publications of the Navy Records Society  By Navy Records Society (Great Britain) More details fromthe court martial records at the UK National Archives: Scope and content ff. 129-136 Thomas Couch, HMS Royal Sovereign. Royal Navy Court Martial, 4 February 1696. Crime: Neglect of duty causing ship to be burnt at her moorings. Verdict: Guilty. Sentence: 31 Lashes, Forfeit all pay and life imprisonment. ff. 129-136 Thomas Everden, carpenter, HMS Royal Sovereign.
